title: Part A

1 point maximum

Description (1 point)

· (Voltage-) Gated channels regulate Na + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3885@ and K + MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaae4samaaCaaaleqabaGaae4kaaaaaaa@379D@ movements across membranes

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Connection between permeability change and membrane potential (1 point per bullet point).

Stage II:

· Increased permeability to Na + MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3885@ causes depolarization (cell becomes more positive)

Stage III:

· Increased permeability to K + MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaae4samaaCaaaleqabaGaae4kaaaaaaa@379D@ causes repolarization (cell becomes more negative)
